00015 int LL_ishead(struct linkedlist *ll, struct node *n) {
00016         if(n == ll->head)
00017                 return 1;
00018         else
00019                 return 0;
00020 }
00021 
00022 int LL_istail(struct linkedlist *ll, struct node *n) {
00023         if(n == ll->tail)
00024                 return 1;
00025         else
00026                 return 0;
00027 }

00034 struct linkedlist* LL_init (char *name) {
00035         struct linkedlist *ll = (struct linkedlist*)malloc(sizeof(struct linkedlist));
00036     strncpy(ll->name, name, sizeof(ll->name));
00037     ll->head = NULL;
00038     ll->tail = NULL;
00039     return ll;
00040 }

00048 void LL_append (struct linkedlist *ll, char *key, char *value) {
00049         if(ll->head == NULL ) {
00050                 ll->head = (struct node*)malloc(sizeof(struct node));
00051 
00052         ll->head->prev = NULL;
00053         ll->head->next = NULL;
00054 
00055         strncpy ( ll->head->key, key, sizeof(ll->head->key) );
00056         strncpy ( ll->head->val, value, sizeof(ll->head->val) );
00057 
00058         ll->tail = ll->head;
00059     }
00060     else {
00061         struct node *n = (struct node*)malloc(sizeof(struct node));
00062         strncpy ( n->key, key, sizeof(n->key) );
00063         strncpy ( n->val, value, sizeof(n->val) );
00064         
00065         n->next = NULL;
00066         n->prev = ll->tail;
00067         ll->tail->next = n;
00068         ll->tail = n;
00069     }
00070 }
00071 
00075 void LL_dump (struct linkedlist *ll) {
00076     printf("--- '%s' Start ---\n", ll->name);
00077     if(ll->head != NULL) {
00078         struct node *n = ll->head;
00079         while(n != NULL) {
00080             if(LL_ishead(ll, n))
00081                 printf("HEAD ");
00082             if(LL_istail(ll, n))
00083                 printf("TAIL ");
00084             printf("%s :: %s\n", n->key, n->val);
00085             n = n->next;
00086         }
00087     }
00088     printf("--- '%s' End ---\n", ll->name);
00089 }

00098 struct node* LL_search (struct linkedlist *ll, char *str, int is_search_key) {
00099         struct node *curr = ll->head;
00100 
00101         if (is_search_key) {
00102                 while(curr != NULL) {
00103                         if(strcmp(curr->key, str) == 0) {
00104                                 return curr;
00105                         }
00106                         curr = curr->next;
00107                 }
00108         }
00109         else {
00110                 while(curr != NULL) {
00111                         if(strcmp(curr->val, str) == 0) {
00112                                 return curr;
00113                         }
00114                         curr = curr->next;
00115                 }
00116         }
00117         
00118         return NULL;
00119 }

00121 /*
00122  *  @brief  Search a linked list   
00123  *  @param  The key to search for 
00124  *  @return The found node 
00125  */
00126 struct node* LL_search_key (struct linkedlist *ll, char *key) {
00127         return LL_search (ll, key, 1);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*
00131  *  @brief  Search a linked list   
00132  *  @param  The value to search for 
00133  *  @return The found node 
00134  */
00135 struct node* LL_search_value (struct linkedlist *ll, char *val) {
00136         return LL_search (ll, val, 0);
00137 }

00145 int LL_delete (struct linkedlist *ll, char *key) {
00146         struct node *tbd = LL_search_key(ll, key);
00147     if(tbd == NULL) {
00148         return -1;
00149     }
00150     else {
00151         if(ll->head == tbd && ll->tail == tbd) {
00152             free(ll->head);
00153             ll->head = NULL;
00154         }
00155         else {
00156             if(LL_ishead(ll, tbd)) {
00157                 ll->head = tbd->next;
00158                 ll->head->prev = NULL;
00159                 tbd = NULL;
00160             }
00161             else if(LL_istail(ll, tbd)) {
00162                 ll->tail = tbd->prev;
00163                 ll->tail->next = NULL;
00164                 free(tbd);
00165                 tbd = NULL;
00166             }
00167             else {
00168                 tbd->prev->next = tbd->next;
00169                 tbd->next->prev = tbd->prev;
00170                 free(tbd);
00171             }
00172             free(tbd);
00173             tbd = NULL;
00174             }   
00175         return 0; 
00176         }
00177 }
00178 
00186 int LL_set (struct linkedlist *ll, char *key, char *val) {
00187     struct node *n = LL_search_key(ll, key);
00188     if (n == NULL) {
00189         LL_append(ll, key, val);
00190     }
00191     else {
00192         strncpy(n->val, val, sizeof(n->val));
00193     }
00194     return 0;
00195 }

00203 struct database* DB_init() {
00204     struct database *db = (struct database*)malloc(sizeof(struct database));
00205     db->head = NULL;
00206     db->tail = NULL;
00207     return db;
00208 }

00215 void DB_addTable (struct database *db, char *tablename) {
00216     struct linkedlist *ll = LL_init(tablename);
00217     if(db->head == NULL ) {
00218         db->head = ll;
00219 
00220         db->head->prev = NULL;
00221         db->head->next = NULL;
00222 
00223         db->tail = db->head;
00224     }
00225     else {
00226         ll->next = NULL;
00227         ll->prev = db->tail;
00228         db->tail->next = ll;
00229         db->tail = ll;
00230     }
00231 }
00232 
00239 struct linkedlist* DB_getTable (struct database *db, char *tablename) {
00240     struct linkedlist *curr = db->head;
00241 
00242     while(curr != NULL) {
00243         if(strcmp(curr->name, tablename) == 0) {
00244             return curr;
00245         }
00246         curr = curr->next;
00247     }
00248     return NULL;
00249 }
00250 
00259 int DB_set (struct database *db, char *tablename, char *key, char *value) {
00260     struct linkedlist *ll = DB_getTable(db, tablename);
00261     if(ll == NULL) { 
00262         return -1;
00263     } 
00264     else {
00265         return LL_set(ll, key, value);
00266     }
00267 }

00269 /*
00270  * @brief   Delete a node from the given database       
00271  * @param       db - the database that contains the table
00272  * @param       tablename - the name of the table insert into
00273  * @param       key - the key to delete 
00274  * @return      -1 if table not found, -2 if key not found, 0 on success
00275  */
00276 int DB_delete (struct database *db, char *tablename, char *key) {
00277     struct linkedlist *ll = DB_getTable(db, tablename);
00278     if(ll == NULL) {
00279         return -1;
00280     }
00281     else {
00282         if(LL_delete(ll, key) == -1) {
00283                         return -2;
00284                 }
00285     }
00286         return 0;
00287 }
00288 
00289 /*
00290  * @brief   Return a value from the database    
00291  * @param       db - the database that contains the table
00292  * @param       tablename - the name of the table insert into
00293  * @param   key - the key associated with the value to be returned
00294  * @param   returnVal - the string pointer for the found string to be stored in 
00295  * @return      -1 if table not found, -2 if key not found, 0 on success
00296  */
00297 int DB_get (struct database *db, char *tablename, char *key, char *returnVal) {
00298     struct linkedlist *ll = DB_getTable(db, tablename);
00299     if(ll == NULL) {
00300                 return -1;
00301     }
00302         else {
00303         struct node *n = LL_search_key(ll, key);
00304         if(n == NULL) {
00305                         return -2;
00306                 }
00307                 else {
00308             strncpy(returnVal, n->val, sizeof(n->val));
00309         }
00310     }
00311         return 0;
00312 }

00314 /*
00315  * @brief   Print the entire database to the screen
00316  * @param   db - the database to print
00317  */
00318 void DB_dump (struct database *db) {
00319     struct linkedlist *curr = db->head;
00320     printf("** START DB DUMP **\n");
00321     while( curr != NULL ) {
00322         LL_dump(curr);
00323         curr = curr->next;
00324     }
00325     printf("** END DB DUMP **\n");
00326 }

00328 // An example function to show some usage
00329 int DB_TEST() { 
00330     struct database *db = DB_init();
00331     DB_addTable(db, "marks");
00332     DB_set(db, "marks", "ONE", "FOO");
00333     DB_set(db, "marks", "BLA", "POO");
00334     DB_addTable(db, "temp");
00335     DB_set(db, "temp", "TORONTO", "23");
00336     DB_set(db, "marks", "THREE", "SOCK");
00337 
00338     DB_dump(db);
00339     
00340     DB_delete(db, "marks", "ONE");
00341     DB_delete(db, "temp", "TORONTO");
00342     DB_delete(db, "temp", "TORONTO");
00343     DB_set(db, "temp", "OTTAWA", "19");
00344     DB_addTable(db, "socks");
00345     DB_set(db, "socks", "keyone", "black");
00346     DB_set(db, "socks", "keyone", "white");
00347     char buf[100];
00348     DB_get(db, "socks", "keyone", buf);
00349     
00350     DB_dump(db);
00351     printf("%s\n", buf); 
00352 
00353     return 0;
00354 }
